At Tue, 22 Jul 2008 13:18:50 -0700,
Colin Meyer <cmeyer@...> wrote=
:
> 
> Hi,
> 
> I'm running heritrix from the command line, like tgeorgio.
=
> 
> I can start a crawl and watch the progress-statistics.log file to
> se=
e its progress.
> 
> What is the expected behavior when the crawl is done? =
I'm seeing the
> heritrix keep running, updating the progress-statistics.lo=
g with
> lines that indicate no activity. I would have hoped that the proce=
ss
> would end when the crawl is done.
> 
> What is the proper way to end t=
he heritrix process with no web ui?
> Is it ok to just kill the process?
> =

> I'd like to control crawls with some shell scripts.
> 
> Thanks,
> -Coli=
n.
> 
> p.s. I'm still on 1.12.1, to take advantage of the dedupe-plugin.

=
Hi Colin.

When the job is finished the 3rd line of the state.job file shou=
ld be
start with =E2=80=9CFinished=E2=80=9D. It sounds like the job is prob=
ably still
running if the progress-statistics.log is updated. There is a sh=
utdown
command you can use via JMX but a SIGTERM shuts it down pretty clean=
ly.

best,
Erik Hetzner

--Multipart_Tue_Jul_22_13:27:26_2008-1
